alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 4:51AM EDT until August 01 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... The Kentucky River at Heidelberg, affecting Lee County. ...A FLOOD WARNING IS NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...The Flood Warning is for the Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...The Flood Warning is in effect through Sunday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It should fall below flood stage late Sunday night. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.5 feet on 02/27/1929. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by noon.
